newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: The Spanish debt market closed the year at a record high, even though dealers said trade was so light that direction lacked significance.
The March long term future closed at 112.80, up 27 basis points from yesterday, after hitting an intra-day high of 112.86. The previous record was set yesterday at 112.60.
The futures contract closed on January 2 this year at 96.38.
With the German cash bond market closed for holiday, the 10-year spread over Bunds was of little significance, even though it almost hit a record low of 105 basis points.
The Spanish market celebrated New Year with an early close at 1200 GMT. Spain's market will be shut for a public holiday tomorrow and reopen on Thursday.
Also on January 2, the Treasury will tender six-month bills which are expected to set a record low with the yield around 5.90/91 percent from 5.949 at the previous auction on December 18.
